Detailed Description

The CCountingSemaphore class wraps a native FreeRTOS counting semaphore handle (xSemaphoreHandle). To create a counting semaphore instance an object of this class and then call its CCountingSemaphore::Create method like showed in the following sample: 

 CCountingSemaphore g_aSemaphore // global semaphore declaration.

 void taskControlFunc(void *pParams) // a task control loop
 {
       g_aSemaphore.Create(10, 0);

       for (;;) {
              while (g_aSemaphore.Take(portMAX_DELAY) != pdTRUE) {
              // do something
              }
 }
See also:
counting semaphore documentation in the FreeRTOS web site.
Date:
Jul 13, 2010
Stefano Oliveri (STF12.net) E-Mail: softw.nosp@m.are@.nosp@m.stf12.nosp@m..net

Definition at line 37 of file CCountingSemaphore.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CCountingSemaphore::CCountingSemaphore ( )

Default constructor. It initializes the object without attaching it to a native FreeRTOS handle. Call the Create method to allocate a counting semaphore handle and attach it to the object.

CCountingSemaphore.cpp

Create a FreeRTOS counting semaphore and attach its handle to the receiver object.
